title.narrative: Mechanism 14302 - Strengthening High Impact Interventions for and AIDS-free Generation (Aids Free)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
IS & HCWM TBD/Nigeria’s goal is to prevent the transmission of HIV and other blood borne disease by promoting only safe IS & HCWM. It will Develop clear messages on the role of IS & HCWM in developing strong health systems including primary health care. This has been included in HSS components of GAVI and GF, and under the HSS strategic direction of the WHO/PEPFAR collaborative agreement. In FY14 Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.4: Biomedical Prevention - Injection Safety. Policies, training, waste-management systems, advocacy and other activities to promote medical injection safety, including distribution/supply chain, cost and appropriate disposal of injection equipment and other related equipment and supplies. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. objectives

IS & HCWM TBD/Nigeria’s goal is to prevent the transmission of HIV and other blood borne disease by promoting only safe IS & HCWM. It will Develop clear messages on the role of IS & HCWM in developing strong health systems including primary health care. This has been included in HSS components of GAVI and GF, and under the HSS strategic direction of the WHO/PEPFAR collaborative agreement. In FY14 & 15 IS TBD will intervene in Benue, Cross River, Kaduna, Akwa Ibom, Lagos, Rivers, Nasarawa & Federal Capital Territory as focus states while supporting USG treatment IPs across the country. IS TBD will collaborate with NPHCDA to support the decentralization efforts of PMTCT and ART in priority states. IS TBD will conduct TOT, to cascade capacity to all cadre of HCW, including messaging to promote greater male involvement in health as a strategy to improve PMTCT uptake. IS TBD will provide policy support to focal states. IS TBD will provide technical support to other PEPFAR treatment IPs on IS & HCWM. The implementation of the National HCWM Policy will be prioritized. IS TBD will support formative research in focus states to characterize waste generation & use the data to develop & implement sustainable HCWM systems, which have a robust private sector component. IS TBD will use this avenue to grow the industry around HCWM as a means of attracting investment from the private sector. Intervention planning, implementation and monitoring are coordinated with GON and other stakeholders to ensure sustainability of interventions & cost effectiveness. IS TBD will work closely with GON at all levels of the health system to ensure sustainability and ownership. Support supervision will be a corner stone of the program as a strategy to enhance M&E.

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
